title: Lauren Cohan announces her return to The Walking Dead as a series regular in season 11
text:
She helped invigorate the series' tumultuous second season and went on to become one of its most recognizable faces.

Former Walking Dead star Lauren Cohan surprised fans Saturday at New York Comic Con when she revealed she'll be returning to the series for next year's season 11.

The 37–year–old actress originally departed the AMC horror series in 2018 after a failed attempt to gain pay commensurate with her male co-stars.

She's back! Former Walking Dead star Lauren Cohan, 37, surprised fans Saturday at New York Comic Con when she revealed she'll be returning to the series for next year's season 11; pictured with Danai Gurira (L) and Norman Reedus (R)

Lauren looked cool and casual for her panel appearance in an all-blue ensemble.

The 5ft7in British–American actress had on a loose-fitting gray–blue blouse with a silky sheen.

She mixed it with a pair of weathered acid wash jeans rolled up at the hems.

Her brunette locks were styled playfully in a straight shoulder-length cut, and she jazzed up the rest of her look with a pair of elegant beige heels.

Blue mood: Lauren looked cool and casual in a blue–gray blouse, which she paired with weathered acid wash jeans

Simple elegance: Her brunette locks were styled playfully in a straight shoulder-length cut, and she jazzed up the rest of her look with a pair of elegant beige heels; pictured with Danai Gurira (L) and Chris Hardwick (R)

Auspicious debut: Lauren arrived in season two as Maggie Greene, the eldest daughter of Hershel Greene and the future wife of Glenn; pictured with showrunner Angela Kang

Lauren quickly became a staple of The Walking Dead during season two, when the show's group of survivor's took shelter on a farm hidden away from the zombie hordes.

The Mile 22 star was featured as Maggie Greene, the eldest daughter of Hershel Greene, who would go on to marry Glenn and lead the Hilltop colony.

Her presence at Saturday's New York Comic Con event was unexpected, and Lauren arrived in disguise, wearing a leather jacket and carrying a wooden baseball bat, a reference to series villain Negan, while wearing a Friday The 13th–style hockey mask.

After Talking Dead host Chris Hardwick, who was accused of emotional and sexual abuse by his ex-girlfriend by his ex-girlfriend last year, invited the masked figure up for a selfie with the cast, she whipped off her mask to reveal her true identity.

The boss: Maggie would grow in importance and become a leader of the Hilltop colony; still from The Walking Dead

Who? Lauren arrived in disguise, wearing a leather jacket and carrying a wooden baseball bat, a reference to series villain Negan, while wearing a Friday The 13th–style hockey mask

Surprise! After Talking Dead host Chris Hardwick invited the masked figure up for a selfie with the cast, she whipped off her mask to reveal her true identity

'She just brings so much heart and vulnerability to that show,' actor Ross Marquand told Entertainment Weekly after the event.

'I don’t know where they’re going to go with that storyline — I just found out today that she was for sure coming back but I would love to see a conclusion or at least a confrontation with her and Negan. That would be amazing.'

'We’re excited to get our friend back,' added Josh McDermitt, who joined the series in 2014.

'We’ve all been on the show for many, many seasons and so there’s a bond between us and a lot of the castmates including Lauren so it’s nice to have our friend back.'

Old pals: Lauren shared a hug with her on-screen nemesis Negan, played by Jeffrey Dean Morgan

Back in the fold: 'We’re excited to get our friend back,' said actor Josh McDermitt. 'We’ve all been on the show for many, many seasons and so there’s a bond between us and a lot of the castmates including Lauren so it’s nice to have our friend back'

The Walking Dead panel also included details about a new castmember, Paola Lázaro, who will play Juanita Sanchez/Princess.

The character plays a vital role in the final sections of the Walking Dead comics, indicating that the end may be near for the long-running series.

Showrunner Angela Kang gave fans details about the upcoming season 10's opening from space and the role of the Whisperers.

'I’m really excited for people to see what the Whisperers are up to,' she said. 'It’s such a strange and interesting set of villains.'

'The Whisperers are the perfect cross between humans and walkers,' added executive producer Scott Gimple.

Protesting: Lauren left The Walking Dead after appearing in part of season nine when she couldn't get pay commensurate with her male co-stars

Lauren's original involvement with The Walking Dead came to an end with season nine, when she lobbied for a pay increase to put her salary in range with her co-stars Andrew Lincoln and Norman Reedus.

The negotiations with AMC were unsuccessful, and she only appeared in the first five episodes of the season before departing to lead her own spy action–comedy Whiskey Cavalier.

The show was canceled after one season, freeing Lauren up for a Walking Dead return, though it's unclear if she's now receiving equal pay with her fellow male leads.
description: Lauren Cohan looked cool as a cucumber at New York Comic Con in an all-blue outfit. She announced her return to the horror series for next year's season 11, after departing in 2018.
